Element Attribute based methods

These commands give you access to attributes of specific elements

script Base Fitnium Fixture
check attribute xpath=//input[@id='form_firstname']@name value Exception: scriptTable_2_1
check value of attribute xpath=(//input[@id='form_firstname'])@name is firstname Exception: scriptTable_2_2


Window Attribute based methods

These next 2 methods get the attributes from Windows, not from elements in the windows

script Base Fitnium Fixture
check does attribute with name selenium_main_app_window exist in any window Exception: scriptTable_3_1
check does attribute with name name and value selenium_main_app_window exist in any window Exception: scriptTable_3_2

We can store all attribute values in a fitnium variable

script Base Fitnium Fixture
store attribute name from all windows in attrs
check get fitnium variable called attrs [] expected [selenium_main_app_window]
